newsitem.title: FRANCE: HAVAS, RICHEMONT IN DEAL ON CANAL PLUS.
newsitem.headline: HAVAS, RICHEMONT IN DEAL ON CANAL PLUS.

text.p: French media group Havas and Switzerland's Cie Financiere Richemont have reached agreement on their shareholdings in French pay television group Canal Plus , Havas said in a statement on Monday.
Under the agreement, Havas will hold 34 percent of Canal Plus and Richemont will have 15 percent.
The agreement will take effect when Cie Generale des Eaux and Audiopar contribute their shareholdings in Canal Plus to Havas and after Canal Plus and Dutch TV company Nethold BV are merged.
Havas will have seven members on the board of directors of Canal Plus, while Richemont will have three members.
Richemont will have the right to a joint and proportional sale of its shares if Havas disposes of more than 10 percent of the equity capital of Canal Plus.
Havas and Richemont will keep their shareholdings at the current level as long as French law prohibits holding more than 49 percent of the equity of Canal Plus.
